LocalizableTextStrings.String: This program is in alpha and may be unstable. Make sure you carefully test any exported mods to ensure they're working properly. If you find any bugs, please report them on GitHub.
Is Non Persisted (does not save or load, removed when traveling)

Sims with the trait will not be able to receive buffs with these emotions. Please beware that this can interfere with gameplay. Goals that require Sims to be in a specific emotion will be impossible to complete, and buffs that have gameplay modifying effects will not work.
These social interactions will be available to Sims who have the trait or buff.

These actions are applied when a Sim is first placed in the world or when a trait is added through gameplay. This is intended for giving Sims a "head start" on life, for example setting Character Values from Parenthood. These actions are not always guaranteed to run and will not be undone when a trait is removed (such as through the Re-Traiting Potion or cheats).

Mixer interactions are "idles" that can be performed while the Sim has the trait or buff. By default, these interactions are hidden from the player and can only be performed autonomously. A common use of these interactions is to use lock out times to run an action at a random interval (emotional buffs added by EA traits, like "Feeling Sad", are added using Mixer Interactions). Warning: Setting the lock out time too low can cause simulation lag.

When Sims are meant to receive the original buff, Sims with the trait will receive a replacement instead. WARNING: This can prevent parts of the game that expect the original buff from working properly. Because of this, it is recommended you avoid replacing buffs that are tied to gameplay (for example: pregnancy buffs, buffs that appear when Sims have low Needs, role buffs, festival buffs, etc). In such cases, an alternative would be to use an action to have a buff spawn in addition to the original, not instead of.

Broadcasters are used to add buffs or run actions when in the proximity of another Sim. For example, a Sim who is interested in vampires could get an Energized buff around vampires. Effects can also be applied to the receiver; for example, a bully Sim could cause all other Sims to get a Scared buff.
Note: Conditions are applied to the receiver, not the sender.

Commodities are used to make Sims autonomously desire to perform certain interactions. In this section, you can add commodities from existing traits, emotions and other EA resources. You can also set the score so that a Sim will desire interactions more or less than normal. Commodities can also do other things for more advanced modders.

These actions will run every 10 Sim minutes (unless configured in Advanced Settings). A common use is to check the conditions of a Sim (such as which interaction they're currently performing or which venue they're in) and apply a buff based on those conditions.

These modifiers cause the game to treat the Sim as if their skill is higher or lower in certain contexts. For example, if a Sim is at level 3 of the Cooking skill, and has an effective Cooking skill modifier of 2, they'll cook at a quality as if they were at level 5. Not all parts of the game are effected by effective skill modifiers.
These modifiers effect how quickly a need will increase while performing an interaction. For example, a Sim with a positive Energy multiplier will need less sleep before their Energy fills up.
These modifiers effect how quickly a Sim will build relationships.
These modifiers effect how much a Sim's relationship score will go down when performing negative interactions. It has no effect on how much it will decay naturally.
These modifiers effect the strength of all buffs with a certain emotion. For example, a modifier of 2 for Angry will make it so that a single +1 Angry buff will be treated like two +1 Angry buffs.
These modifiers will cause all buffs in a certain category (generally, buffs with a certain emotion) decay faster or slower.
These modifiers will cause a statistic to continuously increase or decrease over time.
If checked, Sims on residential lots they don't own will be considered greeted and allowed inside.
The following options are only needed for situations that will be displayed in the UI:
Is intended as a player facing situation
This should be checked if the situation is intended to be a social event or other form of non-background situation. This will prevent the player from traveling. It will also block super speed 3.
Right click a condition group to add an action.
Run when the trait or buff is added
Run when a Sim with the trait or buff is loaded into the world
Run when the trait or buff is removed

Note: STBL (text string) keys will always show as 0x0 in previews. When exporting, Mod Constructor automatically merges identical strings into a single key, which requires all elements to be exported.
This element is context-specific. It does not show in the sidebar and will automatically be deleted on export if it is not reference anywhere.
This element has context modifiers and cannot be converted to a root element.
If not empty, the element will use the defined instance key instead of generating one from the ID. This can be used to create default replacements.

Please note: If a goaled social event is started by a Sim with the Perfect Host aspiration reward trait, or a Sim with Great or Pristine reputation, the event will automatically skip to bronze. The game's code does not contain an option to disable this. Keep this in mind when creating the event.

The description of the Gold reward will be shown as the "Challenge Rewards" in the Plan a Social Event UI. If this is a social event and "Is Household Reward" is unchecked, the reward will go to the Sim who planned the event, regardless of their situation job (even if they're not even part of the event).
If checked, the "Goaled Event" checkbox in the Plan a Social Event will be greyed out and cannot be unchecked.
Include the residential lots of Sims who are part of the situation

Normally, the game would choose a random goal from the set. In Linear Mode, the player will be given all the goals, one after the other, in the order listed. This works by automatically generating a seperate goal set for each goal and chaining it to the previous. Any manually added chained goal sets will be added at the end of the generated chain.
A random chained goal set will be chosen when a goal in this set is completed.
Add self to the list of chained goal sets (this allows the set to repeat itself when a goal is completed)
Set Cooldown (the goal won't reappear for a certain amount of time)
Set Iterations (require the goal to be completed multiple times)

While Mod Constructor supports up to 100 iterations, the holiday tradition system was only designed for up to 6. Any amount above 6 should be considered experimental (for numbers above 6, those that are divisible by 100 are more likely to be safe than ones that aren't).
Set Score (if unchecked, score depends on context)
The goal will only be given to Sims in situation jobs with these tags.
These conditions must pass in addition to the goal for it to count.
These conditions must pass for the goal to be selected from a goal set or whim set.

The definition of success depends on how the game defines it. For positive social interactions, the interaction is successful if it leads to a positive relationship gain. For games, the interaction is successful if the Sim wins.
Include interactions that were cancelled by the player
Include interactions that were cancelled by the game
Require the target to be part of the same situation
For example, if this goal is part of a social event, it will only count if the other Sim is also part of the event.
Use {0.SimName} in the goal name to display the name of the target.
The target must be in a situation job with one of these tags for it to count. This is normally used in conjunction with "Require the target to be part of the same situation".
If the interactions are social interactions, these conditions will be run on the target.
Right click a condition group to add an effect.
Run Loot Action Sets on Receiver
Run Loot Action Sets on Sender
If unchecked, the CAS trait will be determined automatically based on the category. This should always be checked for custom categories, unless this is a child aspiration.
Aspirations are made of milestones (objective sets) and objectives.
Although the reward doesn't have to be a trait, it will still be prefixed with "Reward Trait" in the UI.
Only require the Sim to complete some objectives

If checked, the objective set will always be enabled and tracked through the Sim's entire life, without needing to be unlocked by an aspiration, career or other part of the game.
You can still set "Always Track" on individual objectives without applying it to the whole set. If you do this, objectives will register as complete, but the set will only register as complete when activated.
Only track on the Sim's home lot
This is useful for creating objectives that check the value of the current lot, where you only want it to effect the Sim's home lot.

In addition to the primary condition, these conditions must pass for the objective (or an iteration of it) to count as completed. Unlike with situation goals, these can use participants (for example, setting the participant to TargetSim for an interaction objective will have it so that the condition is run on the recipient of the interaction).
If checked, the objective will always be tracked in the background, regardless of context. If unchecked, the objective will only be tracked when it is unlocked by an aspiration or career.
These buffs will be added to the Sim while they are on the lot. This requires the Sim to be on the lot itself, not the open area around the lot. The buff will be removed if the Sim walks off the lot.

While lot traits are technically temporary, you can get around this limitation by setting the value so high that it would take real life decades to expire.
By default, buffs created by clicking "Create" have a duration of 2147483647 (the max possible value), have "Add Emotion Category" disabled, have their timeout hidden and don't persist when saving and loading or traveling (when loading, the game will create a new instance of the buff, so it isn't necessary to keep the old one).
It is recommended you keep these settings at their default values, unless you know what you're doing.
Note about durations and default settings

These actions will run when a Sim enters the lot. This requires the Sim to be on the lot itself, not the open area around the lot. These actions can be run multiple times if the Sim walks into the open area then back onto the lot.

These actions will run when a Sim travels or enters the open area around the lot. !!WARNING!! These actions are NOT guaranteed to run for every Sim who leaves the lot. There are ways to bypass them, for example, by traveling with one Sim, then summoning another from the UI. This should only be used in special cases, such as when working with content that doesn't normally persist when traveling, or for very minor features where it doesn't matter if you can bypass them.
This allows interactions like Hide Under Covers and Take Cold Shower to change the decay rate.
Open this buff in a seperate tab for more options, such as actions and gameplay modifiers.

Adds a buff that will persist while the condition is met, and then be removed when it is no longer met. This is intended to be used with the "Actions" category on a trait or buff, and will not work properly if used anywhere else.
Statistics: Change Buff or Statistic by Category (Fixed Amount)
Statistics: Change Buff or Statistic by Category (Percentage)
Statistics: Set Statistic to Exact Value
Statistics: Set Statistic to Random Value In Range
Ignore if the Sim already has the buff
Are you sure you want to delete the action? This cannot be undone!
This is the text that will appear below the name of the buff in the UI, indicating why it was added. For example: (From Custom Trait)
Do not refresh timeout if the buff is re-added when the Sim already has it
Type {0.TimeSpan} to display the number of Sim minutes remaining.
Careers: Has Career with No Time Off
Checks the total amount of time a Sim has spent performing interactions with a tag. Because of how the game is programmed, this can only be used with tags, not individual interactions.
Can be used to check how much money a Sim has and/or how much the active lot is worth.
(Can optionally be limited to only money earned through a specific royalty tag)
This checks the total amount of club points the Sim has ever earned across all clubs, regardless of how much they currently have.

This is used for some EA objectives including performing an encouraged club interaction or influencing a Sim with Neighborhood Stories. Click the gears icon after selecting this objective type to see a list of valid event types.
If unchecked, the condition will treat the statistic as if it has a value of 0.

The participant is which Sim or object an action or condition will be applied to. If left empty, the game will decide based on the type of action or condition (usually, but not always, Actor).
Some common values include: Actor - The Sim initiating an action. This is the most common, and usually the default. TargetSim - The Sim being targetted by a social interaction. ActiveHousehold - All Sims in the active household. AllOtherInstancedSims - Every Sim that has currently been loaded into the world.
If checked, the reward will be applied to the entire household and any objects will be placed in the household inventory.
Get UI info from the first custom trait reward
This only works with custom traits that are part of this mod. It does not work with EA traits or manually inputted keys.

If the mod has any Compound Condition elements, they will show up here for quick selection. Compound Conditions can be used to group multiple conditions together or require only some conditions to pass.

Simple situations are made up of "situation jobs" with assigned "role states". "Host" and "Guest" are two common examples of jobs. A job's Sims can be chosen by the player from the Plan a Social Event UI, auto invited by the game, or a combination of both. Role states are lists of buffs added to Sims, typically used to determine their autonomy.
This is the minimum and maximum number of Sims the player can invite through the social event UI.
Allows you to specify a minimum and maximum number of Sims that will automatically show up without needing to be invited by the player.
Can be hired in the social event UI

If checked, Sims with this job will always show up before Sims in other jobs that don't have this option enabled. This is useful for large events, as it can ensure that if the maximum number of Sims on the lot is reached (20, unless changed by a mod), important jobs will be prioritized over unimportant ones.
Confirm when leaving the situation for work
Sims outside the active household should ignore work
Replace Sims that don't show up
Only show the tooltip if the active Sim is in the same situation

Role Tags can be used to restrict certain goals by or on certain jobs. For example, for a "Hosts Socialize with Guests", you'd need to assign Role_Host to the host job, and Role_Guest to the guest job. Tags are optional and only necessary if you intend to use the functionality associated with them.
Click "Browse" for a list of supported tags. You can only use tags that already exist, as the game's code does not support custom tags.
Only Sims that match this filter can be part of the situation. If there aren't enough Sims to meet the auto invite count, the game will generate new Sims or conform existing ones.
These actions will run on all Sims with the job when a goaled event is over. They can be configured to only run at a certain level medal.
If checked, the outfit for this situation will be prioritized over other running situations. This should usually be left unchecked except in special cases.
Role states are a list of buffs added to Sims, typically used to define their autonomy.
Are you sure you want to delete the element: {label}?
The mod has been exported successfully.
The mod has been exported with errors.
Time until the interaction is available after loading:
Time until the interaction is available again after performing:
Preset: Standard EA settings for adding a buff at a random interval

Custom tuning allows you to define your own XML code that will be included in the exported file for an element.
Tunables that were already set by Mod Constructor will be replaced, rather than duplicated. If a list that already exists is defined, its items will be merged with the existing list.
If you include an element ID after a hashtag (for example: #MyCustomTrait), it will be replaced with the instance key of that element.
Are you sure you want to remove the selected references?
This mod uses features that require Python (3.7.0), but it is not installed. The mod or certain parts may not work as expected, if at all.

Mod Constructor failed to write a TGI key to a SimData file. This usually means that an icon or image is set to something invalid. Please note that manually adding an image to the "Icons" folder will not automatically make it work. To add a custom image, go to the "Custom Images" tab in the image selector and add it from there.

Note: The goal will not autocomplete if it was already completed before the holiday begins. Because of this, it is recommended that the goal require performing an action rather than just checking the status of a Sim (for example, "Socialize while Energized" rather than "Become Energized").
Preferences that are higher up in the list will override ones that are lower down.
Note: To match how EA traditions are coded, presets use a trait condition instead of a Sim Info condition.
These buffs will be applied to Sims during the holiday.
This is the text shown below the buff name in the UI, for example: (From Custom Holiday Tradition). Because of how the game is programmed, the reason is applied to all of the above buffs.
These buffs will be applied to Sims the day before the holiday.
Aspiration (CAS only, rewards should be set to Gameplay)
Childhood Phase (behaves the same as Gameplay, but has its own UI effect)
Likes (no preference, but can override lower preferences)
Are you sure you want to remove this preference?
Inverted (pass if conditions are not met)
Career level applies regardless of branch. To test for a specific branch, use a Career Level Resource Condition.
Require participant to have a career (if unchecked, participant will be required NOT to have a career)
Require the collection to be complete
Inverted (check if the participant does NOT have the emotion)
Must be owned by the active household
Allow objects in the public area around the lot
This does not negate "Must be owned by the active household". Check this if you want to include portable objects.
This should be checked if the object is created by a Sim (such as a painting or meal) rather than placed in Build Mode or from the inventory.
Only applies if the condition is for an interaction.
Require all the Sim's clubs to pass (otherwise, require only one)
Restrict the number of Sims in the club
Require another participant to be part of the club

Setting this to 0 will make it so every other Sim that the Sim knows will need to pass the condition without exceptions. This is useful if you want to prohibit a Sim from having a certain type of relationship (for example, checking if a Sim is single).
Check if number of relationships is less than or equal to the defined number rather than the other way around
Used for participant types that contain multiple Sims, such as ActiveHousehold. Set to 0 to require all participants to pass.
Note: Track conditions are optional. The game will still check bit conditions even if the track is left undefined.
Note: Bit conditions are optional. The game will still check track conditions even if no bits are specified.
The condition will pass if the target has any of these bits.
The target will need to have all of these bits for the test to pass.
The condition will fail if the target has any of these bits.
The condition will fail if the target has all of these bits, but will still pass if they have only some of them.
Must be initiated by the participant
This can be used to require a Sim reach a level in multiple skills.
If not empty, the participant will need at least one trait from this list for the condition to pass.
The condition will fail if the participant has any trait in this list.
Are you sure you want to remove this condition?
Are you sure you want to remove this reward?
Unlock In Build Mode (for locked objects)
Only include Sims who are part of the same situation
Note: Because of how the game is programmed, you can have any number of tags, but only one specific interaction.
The goal will complete when the Sim's relationship with the target matches this condition.

This is only valid for goals where "Specific Target" (in "Target Settings") is set to something other than "Any". This condition must pass for the goal to be selected in a goal set or whim set. For example, a "Become Friends with" goal should check to make sure the Sims aren't already friends.
The target must meet these conditions for the goal to count.
Don't select the goal if the conditions are already met
If not empty, the participant will need at least one buff from this list for the condition to pass.
The condition will fail if the participant has any buff in this list.
All careers must have at least one company or else the UI in game will glitch out.
When a Sim gets promoted in the last level of this track, they'll have these branches to choose from.
Duration Extra Minutes (after hours have elapsed)
These are the objectives a Sim must complete in order to get promoted.

The Sim will receive this reward when being promoted to, NOT from, this career level. The extra money a Sim receives when being promoted is part of the reward. Normally, this should be set for all levels except the first.

These conditions must pass for any Sim to be in this career. This should be something that will apply permanently, such as a reward trait. If a Sim who is already in the career stops meeting the conditions, it will be removed when traveling or saving and reloading.

This is a custom tuning element and consists entirely of custom tuning. The instance type, class and module is determined by the content in the <I> tag, while the name and key is determined by Mod Constructor, like any other element.
Custom tuning error: Mod Constructor couldn't find an element with the ID: {id}
Compound Conditions can be used to group multiple conditions together or require only some conditions to pass.
Are you sure you want to delete this group of conditions?
Run Loot Action Sets on Receiver
Run Loot Action Sets on Sender
If defined, the number of receivers must be in the given range.
Enter a new label for this object, or leave the box empty to reset.
If the game tries to change the commodity while the Sim doesn't have it, it will automatically be added.
Remove the commodity when it decays to the lowest value (usually 0)

This amount will be added to all levels starting from the second. For example, if set to 240, the second buff will require an additional 240 points, the third will require 480, the fourth will require 720, and so on.
If this is left unchecked, attempting to add this bit will always add it to both Sims. If checked, it will only be added to one Sim.
These buffs will be added to a Sim with the trait while another Sim who meets a certain condition is in the proximity. For example, a Sim can become Scared around Angry Sims.
These conditions must pass for the proximity buff to be applied.
Remember to set the participant to TargetSim to have it apply to the Sim in the proximity, rather than the Sim with the trait.

Using a Python script, this action set can be merged to other action sets. For example, merging onto the \"loot_Commodity_CareerBenefit_Agent_Main_Level\" loot (109228, intended for the \"Perform Friendly Interactions\" daily task) will cause the loot to run every time the Sim performs a friendly social interaction. Participants will work the same as the loot it's merged to.

Loot merges are global and apply regardless of the context the original set. For example, including an action set in the "Actions" section of a custom trait will NOT automatically make it so the actions will only be run on Sims with the trait. Generally, this feature should only be used on root elements created directly from the "Add Element" dialog.
These conditions must pass for the interaction to be available.
The game will treat this as an "idle" interaction. This is typically used for interactions attached to traits or buffs.
Always available even if not assigned to a trait or buff

The interaction must meet a certain "score" - determined by various factors such as relationship with the target and current emotion - to be available. 15 and 17 are common values used in EA interactions.
Statistics: Change Statistic by Fixed Amount
Are you sure you want to delete this replacement?
Are you sure you want to remove the selected company name?
Can be selected as the "head start" assignment when a Sim starts the career
Normally, the Name should be plural while the CAS Name should be singular.
Instance type is not set for Custom Tuning Element: {id}
Module is not set for Custom Tuning Element: {id}
Class is not set for Custom Tuning Element: {id}
Run when the interaction greatly succeeds
Run when the interaction succeeds normally
Run when the interaction fails normally
Run when the interaction fails horribly
Run when the interaction fails due to social context (EA considers this the worst type of failure)
Run when the interaction is successful

This will turn the event into an Activity Event.
IMPORTANT: This will alter how the UI works. The amount of time remaining will not be shown to the player, and the game's code does not allow this to be changed. The medal level also won't be shown, although the medal system is still used in the background, and activity goals can have scores that will contribute to the outcome.
This reference is already set to a custom element. Do you want to create a new one and change it?
This is the number of objective SETS the Sim will be assigned, NOT individual objectives. The sets will be chosen at random from those that pass the condition.
Are you sure you want to delete the selected role state change?
These buffs will be added to Sims that have the trait, and will be permanent unless the trait is removed.
The text displayed below the trait in the UI, indicating why it was added. For example: (From Completing a Custom Aspiration)
The Sim will receive this reward after completing the Objective Set. This should only be used in special cases.
This option allows a Sim's role state to change over time during the situation.
It is recommended you install Python 3.7.0 on your computer. It is needed for certain mods, such as interactions, to export properly.
(Installer may take a few seconds to load)
Run when the situation ends at gold
Run when the situation ends at silver
Run when the situation ends at bronze
Run when the situation ends with no medal
Is Cheat (requires TestingCheats, hidden behind shift+click)
Only Ony Allowed (when selecting a new trait, any trait in the list the Sim already has will be removed)
Only allow on the active (selected) Sim
The situation will show in the UI and, if this is a goaled event, have goals. PLEASE NOTE: This action will be skipped altogether if there is already a player facing situation running.
The primary participant is used for parts of the event that are relevant to a specific Sim, like availability conditions, relationship filters and non-household rewards.
Is Inverted (pass if a player facing situation CAN'T be created)
Are you sure you want to remove the selected item?
Refresh on timeout if the condition of the first objective is still met
This only checks the first objective, not the entire set.
The whim set will activate when a Sim completes these objectives.

The "level" is the star rating shown in the Find Odd Jobs UI plus one (level 1 is zero stars). The values commonly used in EA odd jobs are 1 for Low bucket jobs, 4-5 for High bucket jobs, and 6 for Very High bucket jobs. There are no EA odd jobs that have values of 2 or 3.
Use the number 6 to display the text tokens of the Sim giving the job (for example: {6.SimFirstName})
The recommended skill has no effect on odd jobs that have assignments, although the icon and text will still be shown.
If the Sim is more than this many levels below the recommended skill level, the job will always result in a critical failure.

By default, odd jobs are rabbithole jobs, meaning Sims will go off the lot for a few hours. Checking "Is Assignment Job" will turn this into the type of job with active objectives. The "Duration" defined in "Situation Info" determines how much time a Sim has to complete the objective set.
Situations: Can Create Player Facing Situation

Checks if the game is in a state where a player-facing situation can be started (for example, one is not already running). This is automatically applied to "Start Situation" loot actions, but in some cases, you may want to apply it manually, like restricting an interaction to start a situation, or when running multiple actions along with the start situation action.
Runs actions immediately when clicking the interaction in the pie menu, without it needing to be added to the queue.
One Shot (Add to Queue then Run on Spot)
